finish.docs:
This action will stop playing audio data from the speaker after all data **is** played.

*See also: [`speaker.finish` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-finish-action)*

mute_off.docs:
This action will unmute the speaker.

*See also: [`speaker.mute_off` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-mute-off-action)*

mute_on.docs:
This action will mute the speaker.

*See also: [`speaker.mute_on` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-mute-on-action)*

play.docs:
This action will start playing raw audio data from the speaker.

*See also: [`speaker.play` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-play-action)*

data.docs:
**, list of bytes**: The raw audio data to play.

*See also: [Speaker Components](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-play-action)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The speaker to control. Defaults to the only one in YAML.

*See also: [Speaker Components](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-play-action)*

stop.docs:
This action will stop playing audio data from the speaker and discard the unplayed data.

*See also: [`speaker.stop` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-stop-action)*

volume_set.docs:
This action will set the volume of the speaker.

*See also: [`speaker.volume_set` Action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-volume-set-action)*

i2s_audio.docs:
The `i2s_audio` speaker platform allows you to receive audio via the the [I²S Audio Component](https://esphome.io/components/i2s_audio.html).

*See also: [I²S Audio Speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/i2s_audio.html#i2s-audio-speaker)*

mixer.docs:
The `mixer` speaker platform allows you to mix audio sent to different source speakers into one output which is sent to another [speaker component](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html). Individual source speakers may be ducked (made quieter) with the [apply ducking action](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/mixer.html#mixer-speaker-apply-ducking).

*See also: [Mixer Speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/mixer.html#mixer-speaker)*

resampler.docs:
The `resampler` speaker platform allows you to convert the sample rate of an audio stream and output it to another [speaker component](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html).

*See also: [Resampler Speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/resampler.html#resampler-speaker)*

is_playing.docs:
This condition will check if the speaker is currently playing audio data.

*See also: [`speaker.is_playing` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-is-playing-condition)*

is_stopped.docs:
This condition will check if the speaker is fully stopped audio data and is in idle mode.

*See also: [`speaker.is_stopped` Condition](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-is-stopped-condition)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The speaker to check. Defaults to the only one in YAML.

*See also: [Speaker Components](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#speaker-is-stopped-condition)*

audio_dac.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The [audio DAC](https://esphome.io/components/audio_dac/index.html) to use for volume control.

*See also: [Speaker Components](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html#base-speaker-configuration)*

bits_per_sample.docs:
**, positive integer**: The audio sample bit depth after resampling. Defaults to the output speaker’s bits per sample.

*See also: [Resampler Speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/resampler.html#configuration-variables)*

sample_rate.docs:
**, positive integer**: Sample rate to convert to. Must be between `8000` and `48000`. Defaults to the output speaker’s sample rate.

*See also: [Resampler Speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/resampler.html#configuration-variables)*

play_on_device_media_file.docs:
This action will play a on-device media file.

*See also: [`media_player.speaker.play_on_device_media_file` Action](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#media-player-speaker-play-on-device-media-file-action)*

announcement.docs:
**, boolean**: Whether to play back the file as an announcement or media stream. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#media-player-speaker-play-on-device-media-file-action)*

enqueue.docs:
**, boolean**: Whether to add the media file to the end of the pipeline’s internal playlist. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#media-player-speaker-play-on-device-media-file-action)*

media_file.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The ID of the media file.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#media-player-speaker-play-on-device-media-file-action)*

announcement_pipeline.docs:
**, Pipeline Schema**: Configuration settings for the announcement pipeline.
  * **speaker** (**Required**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): The [speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html) to output the audio.
  
  * **format** (*Optional*, enum): The audio format Home Asssistant will transcode audio to before sending it to the device. One of `FLAC`, `MP3`, `WAV`, or `NONE`. `NONE` disables transcoding in Home Assistant. Defaults to `FLAC`.
  
  * **sample_rate** (*Optional*, positive integer): Sample rate for the transcoded audio. Should be supported by the configured `speaker` component. Defaults to the speaker’s sample rate.
  
  * **num_channels** (*Optional*, positive integer): Number of channels for the transcoded audio. Must be either `1` or `2`. Defaults to the speaker’s number of channels.
  
  

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

buffer_size.docs:
**, positive integer**: The buffer size in bytes for each pipeline. Must be between `4000` and `4000000`. Defaults to `1000000`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

codec_support_enabled.docs:
**, boolean**: Enables the MP3 and FLAC decoders and optimizes the WiFi configuration for streaming high quality audio. Defaults to `true`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

files.docs:
**, list**: A list of media files to build into the firmware for on-device playback.
  * **id** (**Required**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)): Unique ID for the file.
  
  * **file** (**Required**, string): Path to audio file. Can be a local file path or a URL.
  
  

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

media_pipeline.docs:
**, Pipeline Schema**: Configuration settings for the media pipeline. Same options as the `announcement_pipeline`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

on_mute.docs:
**, [Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when muted.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

on_unmute.docs:
**, [Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when unmuted.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

on_volume.docs:
**, [Automation](https://esphome.io/automations/index.html#automation)**: An automation to perform when the volume is changed.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

task_stack_in_psram.docs:
**, boolean**: Run the audio tasks in external memory. Defaults to `false`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

volume_increment.docs:
**, percentage**: Increment amount that the `media_player.volume_up` and `media_player.volume_down` actions will increase or decrease volume by. Defaults to `5%`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

volume_max.docs:
**, percentage**: The maximum volume allowed. Defaults to `100%`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

volume_min.docs:
**, percentage**: The minimum volume allowed. Defaults to `0%`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

file.docs:
**, string**: Path to audio file. Can be a local file path or a URL.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

id.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Unique ID for the file.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

format.docs:
**, enum**: The audio format Home Asssistant will transcode audio to before sending it to the device. One of `FLAC`, `MP3`, `WAV`, or `NONE`. `NONE` disables transcoding in Home Assistant. Defaults to `FLAC`.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

num_channels.docs:
**, positive integer**: Number of channels for the transcoded audio. Must be either `1` or `2`. Defaults to the speaker’s number of channels.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

sample_rate.docs:
**, positive integer**: Sample rate for the transcoded audio. Should be supported by the configured `speaker` component. Defaults to the speaker’s sample rate.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*

speaker.docs:
**, [ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: The [speaker](https://esphome.io/components/speaker/index.html) to output the audio.

*See also: [Speaker Audio Media Player](https://esphome.io/components/media_player/speaker.html#configuration-variables)*
